domainCards.name: I Am Your Shield
domainCards.description: When an ally within Very Close range would take damage, you can mark a Stress to stand in the way and make yourself the target of the attack instead. When you take damage from this attack, you can mark any number of Armor Slots.

domainCards.name: Get Back Up
domainCards.description: When you take Severe damage, you can mark a Stress to reduce the severity by one threshold.

class.name: Guardian
class.description: Guardians are known for fighting with remarkable ferocity even against overwhelming odds, defending their cohort above all else.
class.class_items: A totem from your mentor or a secret key

hope_feature.name: Frontline Tank
hope_feature.description: Spend 3 Hope to clear 2 Armor Slots.

class_feature.name: Unstoppable
class_feature.description: Once per long rest, you can become Unstoppable. You gain an Unstoppable Die (d4 at level 1). While Unstoppable, you reduce incoming physical damage severity by one threshold, add the die's current value to damage rolls, and can't be Restrained or Vulnerable.

subclasses.name: Stalwart
subclasses.description: Play the Stalwart if you want to take heavy blows and keep fighting.

foundation_feature.name: Unwavering & Iron Will
foundation_feature.description:
* Unwavering: Gain a permanent +1 bonus to your damage thresholds.
* Iron Will: When you take physical damage, you can mark an additional Armor Slot to reduce the severity.

specialization_feature.name: Unrelenting & Partners-in-Arms
specialization_feature.description:
* Unrelenting: Gain a permanent +2 bonus to your damage thresholds.
* Partners-in-Arms: When an ally within Very Close range takes damage, you can mark an Armor Slot to reduce the severity by one threshold.

mastery_feature.name: Undaunted & Loyal Protector
mastery_feature.description:
* Undaunted: Gain a permanent +3 bonus to your damage thresholds.
* Loyal Protector: When an ally within Close range has 2 or fewer Hit Points and would take damage, you can mark a Stress to sprint to their side and take the damage instead.

subclasses.name: Vengeance
subclasses.description: Play the Vengeance if you want to strike down enemies who harm you or your allies.

foundation_feature.name: At Ease & Revenge
foundation_feature.description:
* At Ease: Gain an additional Stress slot.
* Revenge: When an adversary within Melee range succeeds on an attack against you, you can mark 2 Stress to force the attacker to mark a Hit Point.

specialization_feature.name: Act of Reprisal
specialization_feature.description: When an adversary damages an ally within Melee range, you gain a +1 bonus to your Proficiency for the next successful attack you make against that adversary.

mastery_feature.name: Nemesis
mastery_feature.description: Spend 2 Hope to Prioritize an adversary until your next rest. When you make an attack against your Prioritized adversary, you can swap the results of your Hope and Fear Dice. You can only Prioritize one adversary at a time.

subclass.name: Vengeance
subclass.description: Play the Vengeance if you want to strike down enemies who harm you or your allies.

ancestry.name: Dwarf
ancestry.description: Short, sturdy humanoids with dense musculature and a natural resilience.

features.name: Thick Skin
features.description: When you take Minor damage, you can mark 2 Stress instead of marking a Hit Point.

features.name: Increased Fortitude
features.description: Spend 3 Hope to halve incoming physical damage.

community.name: Loreborne
community.description: From a society that favors strong academic or political prowess and highly values knowledge.

feature.name: Well-Read
feature.description: You have advantage on rolls that involve the history, culture, or politics of a prominent person or place.

domainCards.name: Deft Deceiver
domainCards.description: Spend a Hope to gain advantage on a roll to deceive or trick someone into believing a lie you tell them.

domainCards.name: Book Of Illiat
domainCards.description:
* Slumber: Make a Spellcast Roll against a target within Very Close range. On a success, they're Asleep until they take damage or the GM spends a Fear on their turn to clear this condition.
* Arcane Barrage: Once per rest, spend any number of Hope and shoot magical projectiles that strike a target of your choice within Close range. Roll a number of d6s equal to the Hope spent and deal that much magic damage to the target.
* Telepathy: Spend a Hope to open a line of mental communication with one target you can see. This connection lasts until your next rest or you cast Telepathy again.

primary.name: Rapier
primary.feature: Quick: When you make an attack, you can mark a Stress to target another creature within range.

class.name: Bard
class.description: Bards are the most charismatic people in all the realms, masters of captivation who specialize in a variety of performance types.
class.class_items: A romance novel or a letter never opened

hope_feature.name: Make a Scene
hope_feature.description: Spend 3 Hope to temporarily Distract a target within Close range, giving them a -2 penalty to their Difficulty.

class_feature.name: Rally
class_feature.description: Once per session, describe how you rally the party and give yourself and each of your allies a Rally Die. At level 1, your Rally Die is a d6. A PC can spend their Rally Die to roll it, adding the result to their action roll, reaction roll, damage roll, or to clear a number of Stress equal to the result.

subclasses.name: Troubadour
subclasses.description: Play the Troubadour if you want to play music to bolster your allies.

foundation_feature.name: Gifted Performer
foundation_feature.description:
You can play three different types of songs, once each per long rest:
* Relaxing Song: You and all allies within Close range clear a Hit Point.
* Epic Song: Make a target within Close range temporarily Vulnerable.
* Heartbreaking Song: You and all allies within Close range gain a Hope.

specialization_feature.name: Maestro
specialization_feature.description: Your rallying songs steel the courage of those who listen. When you give a Rally Die to an ally, they can gain a Hope or clear a Stress.

mastery_feature.name: Virtuoso
mastery_feature.description: You are among the greatest of your craft and your skill is boundless. You can perform each of your 'Gifted Performer' feature's songs twice per long rest.

subclasses.name: Wordsmith
subclasses.description: Play the Wordsmith if you want to use clever wordplay and captivate crowds.

foundation_feature.name: Rousing Speech & Heart of a Poet
foundation_feature.description:
* Rousing Speech: Once per long rest, you can give a heartfelt, inspiring speech. All allies within Far range clear 2 Stress.
* Heart of a Poet: After you make an action roll to impress, persuade, or offend someone, you can spend a Hope to add a d4 to the roll.

specialization_feature.name: Eloquent
specialization_feature.description:
Your moving words boost morale. Once per session, when you encourage an ally, you can do one of the following:
* Allow them to find a mundane object or tool they need.
* Help an Ally without spending Hope.
* Give them an additional downtime move during their next rest.

mastery_feature.name: Epic Poetry
mastery_feature.description: Your Rally Die increases to a d10. Additionally, when you Help an Ally, you can narrate the moment as if you were writing the tale of their heroism in a memoir. When you do, roll a d10 as your advantage die.

subclass.name: Wordsmith
subclass.description: Play the Wordsmith if you want to use clever wordplay and captivate crowds.

ancestry.name: Firbolg
ancestry.description: Bovine humanoids, often tall and muscular, with broad noses and drooping ears.

features.name: Charge
features.description: On a successful Agility Roll to move from Far range into Melee, mark a Stress to deal 1d12 physical damage to all targets in Melee.

features.name: Unshakable
features.description: When you would mark a Stress, roll a d6. On a 6, don't mark it.

community.name: Orderborne
community.description: From a collective that focuses on discipline or faith, upholding a set of principles that reflect your experience.

feature.name: Dedicated
feature.description: Record three sayings or values your upbringing instilled in you. Once per rest, when you embody one of these principles, you can roll a d20 as your Hope Die.

domainCards.name: Vicious Entangle
domainCards.description: Make a Spellcast Roll against a target within Far range. On a success, roots and vines reach out from the ground, dealing 1d8+1 physical damage and temporarily Restraining the target. Additionally on a success, you can spend a Hope to temporarily Restrain another adversary within Very Close range of your target.

domainCards.name: I See It Coming
domainCards.description: When you're targeted by an attack made from beyond Melee range, you can mark a Stress to roll a d4 and gain a bonus to your Evasion equal to the result against the attack.

class.name: Ranger
class.description: Rangers are highly skilled hunters who become sly tacticians, pursuing their quarry with cunning and patience.
class.class_items: A trophy from your first kill or a seemingly broken compass

hope_feature.name: Hold Them Off
hope_feature.description: Spend 3 Hope when you succeed on an attack with a weapon to use that same roll against two additional adversaries within range of the attack.

class_feature.name: Ranger's Focus
class_feature.description: Spend a Hope on a successful attack to make the target your Focus. You always know their direction, they mark Stress when you damage them, and you can reroll a failed attack against them by ending the Focus.

subclasses.name: Beastbound
subclasses.description: Play the Beastbound if you want to form a deep bond with an animal ally.

foundation_feature.name: Companion
foundation_feature.description: You have an animal companion of your choice. Take the Ranger Companion sheet and choose a level-up option for them when you level up.

specialization_feature.name: Expert Training & Battle-Bonded
specialization_feature.description:
* Expert Training: Choose an additional level-up option for your companion.
* Battle-Bonded: When an adversary attacks you while they're within your companion's Melee range, you gain a +2 bonus to your Evasion against the attack.

mastery_feature.name: Advanced Training & Loyal Friend
mastery_feature.description:
* Advanced Training: Choose two additional level-up options for your companion.
* Loyal Friend: Once per long rest, when the damage from an attack would mark your companion's last Stress or your last Hit Point and you're within Close range of each other, you or your companion can rush to the other's side and take that damage instead.

subclasses.name: Wayfinder
subclasses.description: Play the Wayfinder if you want to hunt your prey and strike with deadly force.

foundation_feature.name: Ruthless Predator & Path Forward
foundation_feature.description:
* Ruthless Predator: When you make a damage roll, you can mark a Stress to gain a +1 bonus to your Proficiency. Additionally, when you deal Severe damage, the adversary marks a Stress.
* Path Forward: You can identify the shortest path to a place you've visited before.

specialization_feature.name: Elusive Predator
specialization_feature.description: When your Focus makes an attack against you, you gain a +2 bonus to your Evasion against the attack.

mastery_feature.name: Apex Predator
mastery_feature.description: Before you make an attack roll against your Focus, you can spend a Hope. On a successful attack, you remove a Fear from the GM's Fear pool.

subclass.name: Beastbound
subclass.description: Play the Beastbound if you want to form a deep bond with an animal ally.

community.name: Wanderborne
community.description: You've lived as a nomad, forgoing a permanent home and valuing information, skills, and connections over possessions.

feature.name: Nomadic Pack
feature.description: Add a Nomadic Pack to your inventory. Once per session, you can spend a Hope to pull out a mundane item that's useful to your situation.

* Telepathy: Spend a Hope to open a line of mental communication with one target you can see. This connection lasts until your next rest or you cast Telepathy again.

domainCards.name: Bolt Beacon
domainCards.description: Make a Spellcast Roll against a target within Far range. On a success, spend a Hope to send a bolt of shimmering light toward them, dealing d8+2 magic damage using your Proficiency. The target becomes temporarily Vulnerable and glows brightly until this condition is cleared.

class.name: Wizard
class.description: Wizards acquire and hone immense magical power over years of learning using a variety of tools.
class.class_items: A book you're trying to translate or a tiny, harmless elemental pet

hope_feature.name: Not This Time
hope_feature.description: Spend 3 Hope to force an adversary within Far range to reroll an attack or damage roll.

class_feature.name: Prestidigitation & Strange Patterns
class_feature.description:
* Prestidigitation: You can perform harmless, subtle magical effects at will.
* Strange Patterns: Choose a number between 1 and 12. When you roll that number on a Duality Die, gain a Hope or clear a Stress.

subclasses.name: School of Knowledge
subclasses.description: Play the School of Knowledge if you want a keen understanding of the world around you.

foundation_feature.name: Prepared & Adept
foundation_feature.description:
* Prepared: Take an additional domain card of your level or lower.
* Adept: When you Utilize an Experience, you can mark a Stress instead of spending a Hope. If you do, double your Experience modifier for that roll.

specialization_feature.name: Accomplished & Perfect Recall
specialization_feature.description:
* Accomplished: Take an additional domain card of your level or lower.
* Perfect Recall: Once per rest, when you recall a domain card in your vault, you can reduce its Recall Cost by 1.

mastery_feature.name: Brilliant & Honed Expertise
mastery_feature.description:
* Brilliant: Take an additional domain card of your level or lower.
* Honed Expertise: When you use an Experience, roll a d6. On a result of 5 or higher, you can use it without spending Hope.

subclasses.name: School of War
subclasses.description: Play the School of War if you want to utilize trained magic for violence.

foundation_feature.name: Battlemage & Face Your Fear
foundation_feature.description:
* Battlemage: You've focused your studies on becoming an unconquerable force on the battlefield. Gain an additional Hit Point slot.
* Face Your Fear: When you succeed with Fear on an attack roll, you deal an extra 1d10 magic damage.

specialization_feature.name: Conjure Shield & Fueled by Fear
specialization_feature.description:
* Conjure Shield: While you have at least 2 Hope, you add your Proficiency to your Evasion.
* Fueled by Fear: The extra magic damage from your 'Face Your Fear' feature increases to 2d10.

mastery_feature.name: Thrive in Chaos & Have No Fear
mastery_feature.description:
* Thrive in Chaos: When you succeed on an attack, you can mark a Stress after rolling damage to force the target to mark an additional Hit Point.
* Have No Fear: The extra magic damage from your 'Face Your Fear' feature increases to 3d10.

subclass.name: School of Knowledge

* Honed Expertise: When you use an Experience, roll a d6. On a result of 5 or higher, you can use it without spending Hope.

ancestry.name: Orc
ancestry.description: Humanoids with square features and boar-like tusks that protrude from their lower jaw.

features.name: Sturdy
features.description: When you have 1 Hit Point remaining, attacks against you have disadvantage.

features.name: Tusks
features.description: On a successful Melee attack, spend a Hope to gore the target with your tusks, dealing an extra 1d6 damage.

community.name: Highborne
community.description: Accustomed to a life of elegance, opulence, and prestige within the upper echelons of society.

feature.name: Privilege
feature.description: You have advantage on rolls to consort with nobles, negotiate prices, or leverage your reputation to get what you want.
